intro: Hieracium scouleri var. nudicaule, commonly known as the naked-stem hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides, and it has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are generally hairy and alternate along the stem, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. It is a perennial species that produces achenes as its seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
